title: Archival node - "required historical state unavailable"

#### Expected behaviour
debug_traceTransaction RPC calls should return traces

#### Actual behaviour
"required historical state unavailable"

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
geth --rinkeby --gcmode=archive --http --http.api=eth,net,web3,debug
Wait until synced, then attempt to trace a transaction/call

#### Backtrace

````
[backtrace]
````

When submitting logs: please submit them as text and not screenshots.

Please provide an exact details about the call you try to trace, and the startup logs from the node. 
`

`geth --rinkeby --gcmode=archive --http --http.api=eth,net,web3,debug` I think you are using the **snap sync** to do the initial sync and after the syncing, node starts to do sync block in archive node. But unfortunately the state before the pivot point are non-existent.

Please also add the `--syncmode full` for the initial sync.

Btw, can you please check the database size? It's might much easier to quick verify my guess.
Yes I would've been using snap sync, I the database was about 60GB I think, I've restarted it with a full sync now
Should I turn snapshot database mode off by the way? I heard you don't need it on if you're running an archive node

> Should I turn snapshot database mode off by the way? I heard you don't need it on if you're running an archive node

Snapshot is recommended, even for archive node.
Close it right now. Feel free to reopen if you still meet problems.
